item.title: 'Dropped an absolute soda': Aussie commentators left shellshocked after Steve Smith drops a sitter. Watch - The Times of India
item.description:
Aussie Commentators Shocked as Steve Smith Drops Easy Catch

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

On Day 4 at the Gabba, Steve Smith dropped a straightforward catch off Pat Cummins' first ball, allowing KL Rahul to capitalize and reach his 17th Test fifty.

  • KL Rahul was on 33 when Smith dropped the catch.
  • Brad Haddin commented on Smith's lapse in concentration.
  • Rahul eventually scored 84 runs before being dismissed by Smith, who made a remarkable catch to redeem himself.
  • Australia's field setup invited Rahul to play his preferred shots.
“That was a concentration lapse from Steve Smith, well bowled Pat Cummins. The ball could not have come slower or in a better position, but Steve Smith has dropped an absolute sitter.” - Brad Haddin

Despite the initial blunder, Smith's redemption came with a spectacular catch, highlighting the highs and lows of cricket.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir jumps out of seat as Akash Deep, Bumrah help India avoid follow-on, Virat Kohli's jaw drops 2 balls later - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir jumps out of seat as Akash Deep, Bumrah help India avoid follow-on, Virat Kohli's jaw drops 2 balls later

Date: Dec 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

India may not win this Test match, but they showcased great resilience on Day 4 against Australia, avoiding follow-on despite a precarious situation.

  • India started Day 4 with a score of 51/4 and faced the risk of follow-on.
  • Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep led a crucial partnership to surpass the follow-on mark.
  • India ended the day at 252/9, giving them a chance to save the match.
  • Ravindra Jadeja and KL Rahul's contributions were also vital earlier in the innings.
“With just three sessions left and rain expected, India are 99.9 percent going to Melbourne, still levelled with Australia at 1-1.”

The Indian team's determination has kept their hopes alive in the series, demonstrating their fighting spirit despite challenging circumstances.

item.title: Like Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, too, a master of his own demise - The Times of India
item.description:
Like Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma, too, a master of his own demise

Date: BRISBANE, Australia

Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma faced his fourth consecutive failure on Australian soil, struggling against Pat Cummins. His lack of confidence is evident, reflecting on his underwhelming batting and leadership.

  • Rohit was dismissed during a critical Test match by Cummins, resulting in a mini celebration from the Australian team.
  • He exhibited poor technique, pushing at deliveries without proper footwork.
  • The Australian bowlers, including Cummins and Mitchell Starc, exploited his weaknesses effectively.
  • Rohit's batting performance has been disappointing, with just one half-century in his last 13 innings.
  • The pressure of past failures is impacting his current performance and captaincy.
“It was the epitome of a nothing shot.”

The ongoing struggles of Rohit Sharma may lead to further disappointment if he doesn't adjust his approach quickly.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah Slams Pat Cummins For Massive Six. Australia Captain's Reaction Goes Viral - Watch - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Slams Pat Cummins For Massive Six. Australia Captain's Reaction Goes Viral - Watch

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 • Source: NDTV

Indian fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah showcased his batting skills by hitting a massive six off Pat Cummins, leading to a viral reaction from the Australian captain during the ongoing Test match.

  • Bumrah hit a six in the 68th over of the Indian innings, stunning Cummins.
  • The six came from a back of the length delivery on the leg stump, showcasing Bumrah's batting talent.
  • India managed to avoid the follow-on, partnering Bumrah with Akash Deep effectively.
“Jasprit Bumrah just smashes Pat Cummins for six! #AUSvIND” — cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau)

The match was also notable for the injury of Australian bowler Josh Hazlewood, who is likely to miss the rest of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series due to a right calf strain.

Cricket Australia confirmed Hazlewood's injury via a statement, indicating a squad replacement will be arranged.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Score, 3rd Test, Day 4: Jasprit Bumrah, Akash Deep's Fightback Ends Australia's Follow-On Plan At Stumps - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia, 3rd Test, Day 4 Highlights

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

The fourth day of the ongoing third Test between India and Australia showcased a remarkable performance by Jasprit Bumrah and Akash Deep, allowing India to avoid following on. At stumps, India scored 252/9, trailing by 193 runs.

  • India managed to avoid follow-on thanks to Bumrah and Deep's resilience.
  • KL Rahul scored 84 runs, while Ravindra Jadeja contributed 77 runs.
  • Pat Cummins took four wickets for Australia, with Mitchell Starc claiming three.
“AND THEY HAVE DONE IT!!!!! India have finally avoided the follow-on.”

The gripping contest on Day 4 ended with India poised to fight back further in the ongoing Test series, with their lower order showing impressive fight.

item.title: From ‘next Tendulkar’ to unsold at IPL auction, Prithvi is looking for The Shaw Redemption - ThePrint
item.description:
The Struggles and Hopes of Prithvi Shaw: A Cricketing Tale

Publication Date: December 3, 2024 • Source: ThePrint

Prithvi Shaw, once hailed as the 'next Tendulkar', faces a challenging phase in his cricketing career. Despite earlier promise, controversies and lack of discipline have muddled his path to redemption. His friends and mentors believe he has the potential to make a comeback but emphasize the need for dedication.

  • Friends and mentors encourage Shaw's return despite a troubled past.
  • Critics highlight his indiscipline, fitness issues, and lack of commitment.
  • Shaw rose to fame young but now faces challenges akin to past cricketing stars.
  • His inconsistency in the national team raises concerns, with few international appearances.
  • Discipline and fitness have been significant barriers to his progression.
  • Former players and coaches express hope for Shaw to utilize available support to succeed.
“Some of the greatest sports stories are COMEBACK stories.”
— Kevin Pietersen

The narrative surrounding Shaw is one of promise interwoven with the need for personal discipline and focus. The cricketing world watches keenly as he navigates this critical juncture in his life.

item.title: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 4 Live Score: Rain forces early Tea, Jadeja leads IND's battle to avoid follow-on - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 4 Live Score: Cummins plots Jadeja dismissal; India on verge of follow-on

Date & Source: Dec 17, 2024 12:45 PM IST, Hindustan Times

India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 4 Live Score: Pat Cummins dismissed Ravindra Jadeja for 77 as India stand in danger of follow-on

  • Pat Cummins dismissed Ravindra Jadeja for 77, putting India on the verge of a follow-on.
  • Rain disrupted play, causing interruptions and early tea.
  • KL Rahul scored 84 runs before being dismissed by Nathan Lyon.
  • Josh Hazlewood is out for the rest of the series due to a calf strain.
  • India need 45 runs to avoid the follow-on.
"There was a sudden change in field placements as Cummins moved his fielders out towards the boundary. Jadeja was baited with the short ball and he went for the big pull towards the deep mid-wicket region. Cummins had stationed Marsh at mid-wicket and the all-rounder made a diving effort to dismiss Jadeja."

India faces a significant challenge as they risk a follow-on in the ongoing 3rd Test against Australia. Cummins' strategic dismissal of Jadeja leaves India in a precarious position. Rain interruptions and Josh Hazlewood's injury add complexity to the match dynamics.

item.title: 'Shubman Gill ko runs ki bilkul bhookh nahi hai' - The Times of India
item.description:
Shubman Gill's Lack of Hunger for Runs Criticized by Basit Ali

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali criticized Shubman Gill and Yashasvi Jaiswal for their dismissals in the first innings of the ongoing Brisbane Test. He highlighted their need for greater hunger for runs and advised them to learn from legends like Sunil Gavaskar.

  • Ali noted that Jaiswal and Gill's early dismissals reflect their lack of seriousness.
  • Gavaskar concurred, emphasizing the importance of shot selection in Test cricket.
  • Gill has played 30 Tests, averaging 36.45, while Jaiswal has made an impressive start with an average of 54.89 over 16 matches.
  • India is currently struggling in the Test, trailing Australia significantly.
“Gill ko toh bilkul hi nahi hai bhookh (Gill is not hungry at all for runs),” said Basit.

In conclusion, both players are encouraged to improve their performances by seeking guidance from experienced cricketers.

item.title: Hazlewood likely to miss rest of India series with calf strain - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Josh Hazlewood Likely to Miss Remainder of India Series Due to Calf Strain

Publication Date: December 2023

Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Josh Hazlewood is expected to miss the rest of the Test series against India after suffering a calf strain during warm-ups in Brisbane. Scott Boland is likely to replace him for the upcoming Boxing Day Test.

  • Hazlewood experienced difficulties and had to leave the field after bowling one over.
  • Cricket Australia confirmed he sustained a right-sided calf strain.
  • Brendan Doggett and Sean Abbott are potential replacements for Hazlewood.
  • The Australian team is facing challenges due to rain delays and now has to rely on a limited bowling lineup.
  • Hazlewood had previously returned to the team after another injury and has missed significant play in recent seasons.
"It's not necessarily your typical side strain... It's caused me a lot of trouble over the last few years." - Josh Hazlewood

This injury raises concerns about Hazlewood's future in the series and his ongoing battle with injuries, impacting the Australian cricket team's dynamics.

item.title: Vinod Kambli consumed 10 pegs of ALCOHOL and scored 100 in Ranji Trophy the next day, cricketer said he is not... - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli consumed 10 pegs of ALCOHOL and scored 100 in Ranji Trophy the next day, cricketer said he is not...

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: India.com

Vinod Kambli, the former Indian cricketer, recently shared an astonishing story of consuming alcohol the night before a Ranji Trophy match and still managing to score a century the next day.

  • Kambli bragged about downing 10 pegs of alcohol and scoring 100 runs.
  • Despite his past struggles with alcohol, he claims to be a social drinker.
  • A viral video of him inebriated raised concerns about his sobriety.
  • Kambli hinted at his willingness to go to rehab for the 15th time if he could receive financial aid from cricket legends.
“If that means Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar will help me financially, I’m ready to go to rehab,” said Kambli.

The incident symbolizes Kambli's complex relationship with alcohol and its impact on his cricketing career.

item.title: Rohit Sharma's 'Gloves Act' At The Gabba Triggers Retirement Speculations - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's 'Gloves Act' At The Gabba Triggers Retirement Speculations

Publication Date: December 17, 2024 | Source: X (Twitter)

The third Test against Australia in Brisbane saw Rohit Sharma dismissed for just 10 runs, leading to speculations about his potential retirement as he threw his gloves in frustration.

  • Rohit Sharma scored only 10 runs in the first innings.
  • His gloves-throwing act sparked retirement rumors among fans on social media.
  • Cheteshwar Pujara commented on Rohit's struggle due to his batting position change.
  • KL Rahul showed resilience scoring after a lucky catch was dropped.
“Rohit Sharma left his gloves in front of the dugout. Signs of retirement?” — Aragorn (@shiva_41kumar, December 17, 2024)

The incident underscores Rohit's ongoing struggle with form and raises questions regarding his future in the game.

item.title: 'Mai ruk gaya tha yaar': Rohit Sharma tells KL Rahul after mix-up - WATCH - The Times of India
item.description:
'Mai ruk gaya tha yaar': Rohit Sharma tells KL Rahul after mix-up - WATCH

Publication Date: [Date not specified] Source: Times of India

Rohit Sharma experienced another difficult performance during the ongoing Border Gavaskar Trophy, scoring just 10 runs in the first innings of the Brisbane Test. He and KL Rahul had a misunderstanding while attempting a run, leading to Rohit nearly stopping in his tracks.

  • Rohit scored just 10 runs in the first innings at the Gabba.
  • The mix-up occurred during a run attempt, causing Rohit to dive to make his crease.
  • Rohit remarked to KL Rahul, 'Mai ruk gaya tha yaar' (I almost stopped).
  • India's total was 180 for 6 at the time of reporting, still trailing behind Australia by 265 runs.
“We as a team are going through transition: Jasprit Bumrah”

The match was interrupted by rain, halting play while Jadeja was batting on 52 and Reddy on 9.

item.title: IND vs AUS: Day after another sordid show, Virat Kohli works to fix flaws in the nets - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS: Day after another sordid show, Virat Kohli works to fix flaws in the nets

Date: [Insert Publication Date] | Source: Times of India

Virat Kohli was seen working hard in the nets in Brisbane, attempting to rectify flaws that have affected his performance in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia.

  • Kohli practiced against various bowlers including Harshit Rana and Prasidh Krishna.
  • He has faced scrutiny for his recent dismissals, particularly outside off-stump.
  • The session was supervised by coaches Morne Morkel and Ryan ten Doeschate.
  • Kohli is looking to regain form ahead of critical matches in Melbourne and Sydney.
“We as a team are going through transition.” - Jasprit Bumrah

Kohli's batting technique is under the microscope as he aims for a strong performance in the remainder of the Test series.

item.title: Vinod Kambli and wife Andrea Hewit EDUCATIONAL qualifications revealed, they studied at... - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli and wife Andrea Hewit EDUCATIONAL qualifications revealed, they studied at...

Date & Source: Not specified

In these collection of pictures, we take a look at the educational qualifications of former India cricketer Vinod Kambli and his second wife Andrea Hewit.

  • Vinod Kambli studied only till 10th standard at Shardashram Vidyamandir School in Mumbai.
  • Andrea Hewit graduated from Mumbai University and has a degree in social sciences.
  • Andrea encouraged Vinod to change his religion to Christianity after their marriage.
  • Vinod has undergone two surgeries after a heart attack, with Andrea taking care of his health.
  • They are currently surviving on a pension of Rs 30,000 per month, down from a previous net worth of Rs 12 to 13 crore.
“Vinod Kambli says Andrea Hewit is taking care of his health, having undergone two surgeries after heart attack.”

Despite their financial struggles, Andrea continues to support Vinod in his health and personal matters.

item.title: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 4 Live Score: Rain returns just after Ravindra Jadeja celebrates fifty - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 4 Live Score: Rain returns just after Ravindra Jadeja celebrates fifty

Publication Date: Dec 17, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The fourth day of the third Test between India and Australia saw Ravindra Jadeja celebrate his fifty just as rain returned to disrupt play once again. India's innings faced multiple interruptions, struggling against Australia's bowling.

  • Jadeja reached his 22nd Test fifty during a rain-affected second session.
  • Play was interrupted after only a few overs due to rain.
  • India was at 180/6, needing 65 runs to avoid the follow-on.
  • KL Rahul played a notable innings, scoring 84 runs before being dismissed.
  • India's batting lineup has faced significant challenges, with multiple players falling cheaply.
“India need to significantly eat into the total themselves rather than rely on the all-round duo.”

As rain continues to affect the match, India's hopes hinge on their ability to withstand Australia's bowling on Day 4.

item.title: LIVE: Rain delays Gabba Test as Jadeja leads India fightback - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Cummins Removes Jadeja, Australia on Verge of Enforcing Follow-On

Date: [Insert publication date] | Source: [Insert source]

On Day 3 of the third Test in Brisbane, Australia's bowlers put India on the back foot, leaving them struggling at 51/4 after a strong first innings performance.

  • Australia scored 445 in their first innings.
  • India is currently trailing by 394 runs with Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul at the crease.
  • Mitchell Starc took 2 wickets, while Josh Hazlewood and Pat Cummins each took 1 wicket.
  • Virat Kohli was dismissed for just 3 runs, further intensifying India's woes.
  • Jasprit Bumrah excelled for India with impressive figures of 6/76.
“India crawled to 22/3 at lunch and was in desperate need of a partnership.”

In summary, Australia's strong bowling performance has put them in a commanding position, with the follow-on looming if they can maintain their form.

item.title: Youngest world chess champion Gukesh returns to hero’s welcome in India - The Guardian
item.description:
Youngest World Chess Champion Gukesh Returns to Hero's Welcome in India

Publication Date: December 12, 2024 Source: The Guardian

Indian chess star Gukesh Dommaraju, aged 18, returned to a hero's welcome in Chennai after becoming the youngest world chess champion.

  1. Gukesh defeated China's Ding Liren in the World Chess Championship.
  2. Hundreds of fans celebrated his arrival at Chennai airport.
  3. Gukesh surpassed Garry Kasparov's record, becoming the youngest champion at 18.
  4. He is the second Indian to hold the title after Viswanathan Anand.
"It means a lot to bring back the trophy to India. I can see the support and what it means to India, I am glad to be here."

Gukesh's victory has inspired many to pursue chess professionally, and he is expected to meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi.

item.title: Where KL Rahul has out-techniqued Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma - The Times of India
item.description:
Where KL Rahul has out-techniqued Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma

Publication Date: [Date Not Provided] | Source: Times of India

KL Rahul's inclusion in India's squad for the Border Gavaskar Trophy faced skepticism initially, but he has proven to be the most effective Indian batter against the Australian bowlers. His ability to adapt his technique has set him apart from other top-order batsmen like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.

  • Rahul has been successful in adjusting to the bowling strategies of Australian pacers, showing notable stability and technique.
  • While other Indian batters struggled with edges leading to dismissals, Rahul's approach has helped him avoid such mistakes.
  • Graphics during the broadcast demonstrated that Rahul’s compact stance allows him to play the ball closer to his body, unlike his counterparts.
  • Former captain Sunil Gavaskar advised Kohli to emulate Sachin Tendulkar's patience to avoid dismissals caught behind.
  • Rahul has a respectable average in this series, displaying consistency with two half-centuries so far.
“He (Kohli) only needs to look at his hero, Sachin Tendulkar... scoring those 241 runs at Sydney. He did not play any shot on the off-side.” - Sunil Gavaskar on Kohli's batting struggles.

In conclusion, KL Rahul’s tactical adjustments have not only enhanced his performance but also highlighted key areas for improvement among his more experienced teammates as India navigates through the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: Rohit Sharma set to 'retire'? India captain's gloves act after Gabba dismissal sparks end of Test career speculations - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma's Retirement Speculations Grow After Gabba Dismissal

Date: December 17, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Rohit Sharma's poor performance in Test cricket continues, leading to speculation about his retirement after his gloves act following a dismissal during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series against Australia.

  • Rohit scored only 19 runs in three innings during the Australia tour.
  • He was dismissed for 10 runs by Pat Cummins, adding to India's struggling batting display.
  • His gloves were left behind near the dugout, prompting fans to speculate about his Test career's future.
  • Rohit had previously retired from T20I cricket after the T20 World Cup win.
  • Concerns are growing about his future in ODI cricket after the upcoming Champions Trophy.
  • He has scored only 152 runs in 13 innings since September, highlighting a significant decline in form.
"If Rohit fails to script a comeback in the remaining two Test matches of the series, the selectors might be forced to think otherwise when India's next WTC cycle begins in July."

As discussions around his cricketing future intensify, the next matches will be crucial for Sharma's career trajectory.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 3rd Test Day 4: Rain delays start in Brisbane - The Indian Express
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Cricket Score, 3rd Test Day 4: Rain stops play in Brisbane

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Indian Express

India faced a challenging Day 4 at the Gabba with significant rain interruptions and a poor batting performance, trailing Australia by 278 runs with 16 wickets remaining.

  • India were at 167/6 at Lunch on Day 4, chasing Australia’s first innings score of 445.
  • Key Indian players like Jaiswal, Gill, Kohli, and Pant fell to Australian bowlers Starc and Hazlewood.
  • The weather played a crucial role with multiple rain breaks impacting the match's progress.
  • Jasprit Bumrah took 6 wickets to help restrict Australia to 445.
  • India's survival hinges on their remaining batsmen against the Australian bowling attack.
“The only uncontrollable, the Brisbane weather, will have a bearing on the outcome of this contest.”

The ongoing match showcases the unpredictability of weather affecting sports, alongside the struggles faced by the Indian team in challenging conditions.

item.title: India vs Australia LIVE Score, 3rd Test, Day 4: Injury Issue Hurts Australia As India Produce Late Fightback - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 3rd Test, Day 4: Ravindra Jadeja Hits 50 But Rain Stops Play Again

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: NDTV

In an ongoing cricket match between India and Australia, Ravindra Jadeja scored 50 runs, but rain interrupted the play again, leading to further delays in the game.

  • Ravindra Jadeja hits a half-century.
  • Rain has caused another stoppage in play.
  • The match is part of the Test series between India and Australia.
